item.title: Additional frauds; email sent to McDonald’s General Counsel CCed to McDonald’s CEO
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: additional frauds Date sent: 2015-10-22 11:06 (Beijing time +0800) To: Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com> Cc: Steve Easterbrook <Steve.Easterbrook@us.mcd.com> Ms Santona, Thank you for answering me. Could you please make sure the French team communicate with me by email? Normal mail takes forever for me to receive now that I live in China and I am not going to wait one month to act if there is an ongoing fraud.

item.title: Reply from Gloria Santona, General Counsel of McDonald’s Corporation
item.description: KEY POINT OF THIS EVENT: By acknowledging that McDonald’s Corporation executives “take such inquiries seriously”, McDonald’s Corporation can’t claim plausible deniability anymore. Furthermore, the email from Ms. Santona who is the General Counsel of McDonald’s Corporation is CCed to the CEO of McDonald’s Corporation Steve Easterbrook. From: Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com> Subject: Re: update Date received：2015-10-21 23:47 (Beijing time +0800) To: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Cc: Steve Easterbrook <Steve.Easterbrook@us.mcd.com> Thanks for your follow-up note.

item.title: Email sent to Gloria Santona, General Counsel of McDonald’s Corporation, requesting an update
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: update Date sent：2015-10-21 22:45 (Beijing time +0800) To: Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com> Cc: Steve Easterbrook <Steve.Easterbrook@us.mcd.com> Ms. Santona, I would like to give a friendly reminder that I gave McDonald’s a deadline of October 22nd 2015 midnight GMT time. So you have about 36 hours left. It was 4 entire days which is more than enough considering I’ve sent my first cease and desist letter back in 2012.

item.title: Email sent to Gloria Santona, General Counsel of McDonald’s Corporation, requesting an update
item.description: Ms. Santona, I would like to give a friendly reminder that I gave McDonald’s a deadline of October 22nd 2015 midnight GMT time. So you have about 36 hours left. It was 4 entire days which is more than enough considering I’ve sent my first cease and desist letter back in 2012. On top of this, had I known that the French branch had started scamming people again, I would have at the time only given you 24 to 48 hours.

item.title: Fraud of the century: emails to McDonald’s executives
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) SUBJECT: Fraud of the century DATE: October 20, 2015 at 03:13 (Beijing time +0800) TO: Gloria SANTONA CC: Steve EASTERBROOK, Robert.Gibbs@us.mcd.com, Silvia.Lagnado@us.mcd.com, Kevin.Ozan@us.mcd.com, Jim.Sappington@us.mcd.com, Mike.Andres@us.mcd.com Ms. Santona, First of all, I want to thank you for having taken my phone call today without hanging up on me right away. Your counter-part in France, Mme de Borda, always refused to communicate with me through phone. Therefore, I greatly appreciate the fact you’ve listened to what I had to say, really.
